bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Walt Whitman to George Routledge & Sons, 19 February 1868
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839-1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

revisionDesc.change: made uniform "George Routledge & Sons" in titles of all letters to and from this publisher
extracted transcription from Major Authors cd

body.p: By your note of 18th, from New York, just received, I find that Mr. Edmund Routledge, editor, would (I quote) like to keep & use an original poem—three-page poem—sent him from me, but demurs to my first-asked price—that he directs you to offer me 10 pounds—which you can send me, $50: in gold—and that, (the terms being settled, &c.) he will advertise it very largely.
I accept the terms offered—$50 in gold—and you can forward me the am't as soon as convenient. I repeat, that I distinctly reserve the right of printing the piece in a future edition of my poems.
Sending best wishes & respects to editor & publishers, I remain.
